trial_identification.studytitle: Improving paediatric palliative care for rural and remote families: a randomised controlled exploratory study of videotelephony
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Improving paediatric palliative care for rural and remote families: a randomised controlled exploratory study of videotelephony

interventions.interventions: Access to usual support plus education, communication, counselling and monitoring with specialist multidisciplinary team members via videotelephone for the duration of palliative care. Information will be collected for the duration of palliation to a maximum of 6 months
interventions.comparator: Usual support via telephone (ad hoc support is provided to families 24-hours a day 7 days a week) and face-to-face visits (the number and duration of home visits and out-patient visits is variable depending on place of residence, disease and care requirments)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Parental health related quality of life as measured using the Medical Outcome Survey (MOS) Short Form SF-12 v2
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed at baseline and every 4 weeks for a maximum of 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Parent reported patient quality of life
Parent reported sibling quality of life

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Paediatric oncology patients aged 2-18 years from regional and remote areas requiring palliative care.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients were a home telephone connection of satisfactory quailty can not be installed.

trial_design.concealment: NHMRC Clinical Trials Centre Randomisation Service
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using computerised sequence generation
